comments.body: I made this a separate test so we could parameterize it with/without eos, without doubling the time of the main integration test.
this seems to be 100% code duplication with the other test. Maybe worth move this so an helper (or abstract class) and unify? (similar other helper methods below)

This really doesn't seem right to me.

I've already unified as much as I felt appropriate by extracting several methods into IntegrationTestUtils, which is the place where we already share common code.

Beyond that, though, these are two different tests. They only do the same topology coincidentally. It seems needlessly complex to introduce an abstract class or some other secondary "test util" class to de-duplicate a few blocks of trivially simple code... It just makes the tests harder to read and maintain.
Since this particular method has just one usage in this file, I will go ahead and inline it, though.
I've pulled more of the common utility code into IntegrationTestUtils. Does it still seem too duplicate-y?
IMHO seems like a good enough change to reduce the duplication and have a separate test.
It's ok :) You reasoning about "same topology by change" makes sense.
